dt: {bc}a source or agent of evil, harm, distress, or ruin

dt.t: the {wi}demons{/wi} of drug and alcohol addiction

dt: {bc}a supernatural being whose nature is intermediate between that of a god and that of a human being
{bc}one that has exceptional enthusiasm, drive, or effectiveness

dt.t: Doug, putting like a {wi}demon{/wi}, had birdies on the third and sixth …

dt: {bc}a software program or process that runs in the background

dt.t: A mailer {wi}daemon{/wi} installed on an e-mail system can respond to a piece of incorrectly addressed e-mail by generating an automated message to the sender that the message was undeliverable.

et: Middle English, "evil spirit," borrowed from Late Latin {it}daemōn{/it} "evil spirit, pagan deity, idol," going back to Latin, "supernatural being, spirit intermediate between humans and gods," borrowed from Greek {it}daimon-, daímōn{/it} "superhuman power, variably evil or beneficent, intervening in human affairs, fate" (Homeric), "personal spirit, bringing luck or ill, that accompanies an individual," "spirit intermediate between humans and gods" (Plato), "evil spirit" (New Testament), probably from {it}dai-,{/it} stem of {it}daíomai, daíesthai{/it} "to divide, allocate" + {it}-mōn,{/it} deverbal noun and adjective suffix {ma}{mat|tide:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: a source or agent of evil, harm, distress, or ruin
an attendant power or spirit : genius

dt: {bc}a source or agent of evil, harm, distress, or ruin

dt.t: the {wi}demons{/wi} of drug and alcohol addiction

dt: {bc}a supernatural being whose nature is intermediate between that of a god and that of a human being
{bc}one that has exceptional enthusiasm, drive, or effectiveness

dt.t: Doug, putting like a {wi}demon{/wi}, had birdies on the third and sixth …

dt: {bc}a software program or process that runs in the background

dt.t: A mailer {wi}daemon{/wi} installed on an e-mail system can respond to a piece of incorrectly addressed e-mail by generating an automated message to the sender that the message was undeliverable.

shortdef: a source or agent of evil, harm, distress, or ruin
an attendant power or spirit : genius

dt.t: Whether you like a skinful, a small sherry at Christmas or are vehemently opposed to the {wi}demon drink{/wi} in all its forms, an exhibition opening in Callington today is definitely worth raising a glass to.

dt: {bc}someone or something that moves or works very fast

dt.t: The new cook is a regular {it}speed demon{/it}.
This computer is a real {it}speed demon{/it} compared with/to my old computer.

shortdef: someone or something that moves or works very fast
